product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I really bought this palette for the highlighters, as the blush shades are ones I already have in my collection. I'm super impressed by the highlights, they're super smooth, buttery, and reflective as shown in the attached picture. They are not glittery at all, just have a subtle shimmery sheen and are very pretty. The blushes (except for the hot pink one) don't show up very well on my skin tone in swatches but on the face they come off decently pigmented and none of the powders have a ton of fallout or anything and blend easily. This is a palette which is worth much more than it sells for,and grabbing it for $8 is a steal, even if you only use the highlighters on the eyes or for Halloween. All three blushes and the pink highlighter are quite wearable (depending on your skin tone) and for the price I would highly recommend picking this up if you're looking for this type of thing.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Hair Condition Dry', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: The highlights(top three) are absolutely beautiful on the skin and they stay very well! The blushes are also very pigmented! I’m really enjoying this pallet especially since I got it for only 8$!!! Great price and product.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Hair Condition Chemically Treated (Colored, Relaxed, or Permed)', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
The blushes do not have much colour payoff, which is ok for my NW10-15 complexion but will be annoying for medium skin tones. The third blush is the only one that is pigmented. The pink one is lighter and less fushia/purple than pictured. They are soft but not buttery and can be a little chalky when you need to apply a lot of product to build up the colour. I love two of the highlighters. The blue one is harder to use because it has a blue/ grey cast when looking forward, at least on fair and light skin. The first one is a nice green/ champagne highlighter ,not too green and no cast. The last one is an iridescent pink that could be compared to a tone downed version of KVD Pink Opal. The blue is a bluish/violet/grey. Very cool tone as every other highlighters in this palette. Ofc nothing is holographic but I think for its price sale of 8$ cad it is a must have. Highlights aren’t as pigmented as other coloured highlighters on the market but it also means they are easier to work with. If only the blushes interest you I would skip it because you kinda forget they are there... they also blend a little patchy.
…read more

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
got it for $5 but honestly if it wasn’t on sale for that cheap, I wouldn’t have purchased it. The blushes are nice and really pigmented. I think the blushes on the side are great for everyday but the middle one is way too pink/purple that it kind of looks like chalk. Might be able to get some use out of it if I mix it with the other blushes though. The holographic highlighters are really cute. it’s definitely not for everyday use but is a fun option to have for special occasions! They would look great as eyeshadows too! Overall, I’m happy with my purchase and will get a lot of use out of this palette! Definitely get it while it’s on sale

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
I wouldn't have paid $30 but I got it on sale for 8 CAD and I couldn't be happier. I only wished it had a mirror. But about the palette...The upper level-highlighters work very well as eyeshadows as well as what they are meant for. The shimmer is very fine and the highlighting looks quite natural. The brown colour is good for contour and the pink and red work as blushes. They blend really well. The blushes have a decent staying power. The highlighter fade earlier, which is fine for me as I am not a big fan of highlighting. I hate looking like a beacon. Al in all this is very good face palette, quite a steal for this price!

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Great, but not worth the price
review_content:
This is a great palette for all skin tones. All blushes are bright when layered but can also be more soft. The highlights are very cute and are as holographic as a highlighter can be. The blushes don't stay on the whole day though, and I find myself often touching up in the bathroom (I don't have a setting spray, perhaps it would stay on better with one?). The only colour that I have a problem with is the middle blue/purple highlight. It is too dark to be a highlight for pale people but I think it would look great on darker skin tones. I can still use it for eyeshadow though so it's not completely wasted. I do not think this product is worth $35 (Canadian) so if you want it, I'd wait until it comes on sale.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Hair Condition Straight', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
Got this as a gift last Christmas. To be fair, it was my first palette so I had nothing to compare it to. But now that I have been using makeup more, I recently got a new palette and it is definitely not as pigmented as this palette. The highlights on this palette have definitely set a standard for me in regards to pigmentation. I just need one application of highlight with this palette and it’s perfect! While with my other palette, I need to apply at least 2-3 times. I don’t really use the purple or pink blushes as I have a red undertone and I find that the blushes bring out my cheeks too much. The warm rose blush though is perfect! My absolute favourite blush. It can somewhat act as contour for me which is great because it looks very natural on my skin tone. I would love to purchase this blush on its own if it exists.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Hair Condition Chemically Treated (Colored, Relaxed, or Permed)', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: They are all very buildable but not all shades work for pale skin like the blue but can be used on the eye. All of the shades do not come out as pigmented as they are in the pan therefore you will not look like a clown unless you overdue it. Definitely worth the clearance price but not the regular in my opinion.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium']
review_title: Fun, flirty and ready for anything!
review_content: This palette is my favorite blush palette of all available ones on the market today. I'm a brown girl with cool undertones and the colors complement my skin perfectly. It has a great day and night selection of blushes and I love that the highlighters are so well pigmented. I dropped and broke my first one and was still traveling with it in a ziplock bag(!) and am so excited to order online to replace it.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: this is pretty good, all the colors are wearable for me (fair skin). worth the clearance price. I pretty much already had dupes for them all but it's good, I'll use it. no formula issues

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Hair Condition Wavy', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Really enjoying this product. I got it for a great price and the quality is good. The blushes made me a little nervous with how bright they are in the pan but they go on subtlety and are buildable for more drama. I don’t see that the highlights do much as far as “transformation” but they look nice nonetheless. All work as eyeshadows as well.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: The colors are true to what I see on the pan, and all of the shades last the whole day on my skin! I also find two of the three highlighters to be nice dupes for pink heart and lucky clover from the ABH Moonchild palette.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
The texture of these is really nice, they blend very well and the colour/highlight lasts most of the day for me. I don't **love** the shades, they really aren't very natural and can be clownish if not careful, BUT I still find myself reaching for this palette most days so they aren't bad either. The brownish blush also makes a really pretty eyeshadow/transition shade if you are very fair skinned (probably to light a shade to show up well on darker skin tones)

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
The highlighters are definitely not holographic nor iridescent, but more like duo-shifting colour. Formula wise highlighters are better than blushes. Both are blend and layer well, 1-2 layers without primer they're last about 6 hours before faded. Highlighters are smooth, nice pigmentation, not accentuated pore, no glittering which I really like. Most unique shade is the soft light gold with bright green shift. Blushes are also smooth and a bit powdery. Pigmentation is quite soft (not scary as in the pan), but can layer to more intense. Most unique shade for me is the magenta in the middle. Attached is a picture of 2 layers finger swatched. Part of blush swatches have highlighter layered on top, so you can compare between using blush highlight and using blush by itself.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I needed a basic blush and highlight palette to start my collection. This had three varied blushes which I could mix or rotate every day. I've only used the white and rosey highlighter and yes, it's labeled as a transformer, but it also works as a highlighter. I have not used the blue on my cheeks, but I have used it on my eyeshadows, and it works great. Positives: - Different blushes: orange (more brownish and I actually use as a bronzer), pink, red - Blendable, and need only about 3-4 taps on my brush to get enough for my preference - Great price for the amount I get Negatives: - The blue transformer looks weird on the blushes

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I went into Sephora expecting to walk out with the new Fenty Highlight palette that I've been drooling over for a week and left with this instead. Absolutely stunning. I tried 4 shades over my Becca x Tiegen's highlights and it blended seamlessly. No glitter specks. No clown look. Just the right amount of colorful-shift glow. Really impressed with this unexpected purchase.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Gray', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I kind of feel like I wasted my money on this one because I can only really use 3 of the 6 swatches. I have fair, olive skin so the blue highlight and bright pink blush look horrible on me, the brown is too muddy to be a blush but too light to be a contour/bronzer. I feel like when I'm done with the 3 pats I can use, I'll have to give the rest to my black friend with blue undertones in her skin. Great if you wanna split with an opposite skin tone friend, but bad if you wanna use the whole thing. On the plus side, the 3 pats that work with my skin tone are really great and I love the yellow highlighter and the coral blush.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Swatched it against the MILK holographic stick and Anastasia Dream Glow kit and this one was probably the best combination of the two. The Anastasia kit had the best iridescent glitter of them all and survived the wipe test the best but the pigment didn't really show (except for the pink) and that's what I was looking for with these palettes. While the glitter isn't as good it is comparably cheaper and offers the pigments I was looking for. The holographic stick had more of a shimmer and not a glitter. The pigment was great but did not survive the wipe test. The pigments in the sephora kit also look way better in person than it does in these photos. The blushes are also great if you happen to be someone who is fairly pale in the winter and then moderately tanned in the summer. There's enough range that I can see myself using all of them at some point.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: BEAUTIFUL! A perfect palette with unique, blinding highlighters and the matte blush pairings I didn't know I needed! Swatched this in store just for fun and immediately put down the more expensive highlighter I was about to buy, because this was way better!!!

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I bought these to try out the whole holographic/colorful highlighter trend and I've been loving both the blushes and the highlighters! They are totally wearable on an everyday basis so long as you aren't too heavy-handed with them (any blush/highlighter will look unnatural and unwearable if you overapply, I find that the opposite applies as well!). Personally, I really enjoy what a light sheen of blue contributes to my otherwise subdued/natural everyday makeup. There are definitely creamier and more finely milled blushes and highlighters out there, but you can't beat this price!

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I was very curious about the highlight shades when buying this product. The colours are gorgeous, but it can give a dry, patchy look to your cheeks if you layer on too many coats. As someone who loves a dramatic highlight, I was somewhat underwhelmed by the effect of this palette, however I still find myself using it weekly. The blush, however, was an amazing surprise! I must say they are extremely pigmented, versatile, and perfect for layering. This is an excellent palette for both beginners and makeup fanatics; I highly recommend it.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I keep beibg surprised by Sephora products. I purchased this after trying a disappointing ABH highlight palette. I expected it to be just as ashy but it wasn't. The colors show up. If you wabt to highlight with blue, it's showing blue, not just flecks of glitter. The product is soft and easy to apply. The colors can be built up. If you want to layer, you can. If I had to pick between ABH and Sephora on this one, Sephora would win and they did. PROS: soft, easy to apply product, true to visual/swatch pigmentation, not overbearing but can be built up to be more, affordable price point CONS: Not a daily palette (unless you can rock them throughout the week).

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Holographic Face & Cheek Palette
user_specs: ['Hair Condition Oily', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: These were my first holographic highlighters that I purchased. I was afraid they wouldn’t be wearable, but surprisingly i am able to wear it to work without it being obnoxiously noticeable. It can be built up to be super noticeable, but that’s not my style. The blushes are also lovely and pigmented and blendable! One of my favorite Sephora collection products!
